name: riding the waves potholder
sizes_available: this potholder measures approximately 7.5" wide x 7.75" long, but instructions are provided to customize the size of your potholder.
notes:
learn a new stitch and add some function to your kitchen with the riding the waves potholder. this potholder is crocheted in the round in one piece, which means that it is double thick, and there is no sewing involved.

the riding the waves potholder uses the half double crochet granny spike stitch to create a fun chevron pattern that pops with 2 or more colours. 

> this potholder pattern is part of the **[2024 potholders galore crochet-along][1]**, and with the purchase of an ebook, you will receive a total of 13 potholder patterns (one pattern every two weeks during the crochet-along).

> if you’d like to be notified when new potholder patterns are released in the crochet-along, you can join the **[2024 crochet along email list here][2]**.

> the free pattern for the riding the waves potholder can be found **[here!][3]**

> the complete video tutorial can be found **[here!][4]**

> you can learn more about the potholders galore crochet along **[here!][5]**

skill level: intermediate

language: english

crochet terminology: us terms

crochet stitch: chain, slip stitch, single crochet, half double crochet

sizes: this potholder measures approximately 7.5” x 7.75”. instructions are also provided to customize the size of your potholder.

> materials:

* 4.0mm crochet hook needed
* any medium 4 worsted weight 100% cotton yarn
* scissors
* yarn needle

yardage:

* 230 yds / 211 m

yarn note: 100% cotton or wool yarn is recommended for potholders because they don’t burn when you place a hot pan/pot on them. cotton blends, and other fibers like acrylic, should not be used.

i hope you enjoy making your potholders!
